<p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>1. Reports menu<br />
1.1 Report example</strong></span><br />
<br />
When loading the Canvas screen the app calls <strong>app.Procast_SP_CANVAS_GetMenuItems</strong> to get the list of reports&nbsp;with the following xml-in:</p>
<pre>&lt;GetMenuItems&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;User_Idx&gt;&lt;/User_Idx&gt; // idx of the logged-in user<br />&lt;/GetMenuItems&gt;</pre>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>The xml below shows an example of how to generate a report for the list.</p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;
&nbsp; &lt;Item&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;1&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Name&gt;Canvas report example&lt;/Item_Name&gt;
<span style="color: #ff0000;">&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Number_Of_Horizontal_Cells&gt;10&lt;/Number_Of_Horizontal_Cells&gt;  - no longer supported since 2.10
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Number_Of_Vertical_Cells&gt;10&lt;/Number_Of_Vertical_Cells&gt;      - no longer supported since 2.10</span>
&nbsp; &lt;/Item&gt;
&lt;/Results&gt;
</pre>
<img alt="" src="data:image/png;base64," />
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>
<strong><span style="color: #ff0000;">NOTE: Every report must have defined at least the properties described above.</span></strong><br />
<br />
The idx is used in the xml-in to load the data for the filters (if any) and canvas area.<br />
The numbers of horizontal and vertical cells describe how many cells the canvas area will be divided into.<br />
<br />
<br />
<span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>1.2 Reports with filters</strong></span><br />
<br />
There is a possibility to filter the data of the canvas area before loading it.<br />
In order to do so add the "HasFilters" node to your report and set its value to "1", as shown on the example below:<br />
<br />
</p>
<p>
</p>
<p>
</p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;
&nbsp; &lt;Item&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;1&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Name&gt;Canvas report example&lt;/Item_Name&gt;
<strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HasFilters&gt;1&lt;/HasFilters&gt;</strong>
&nbsp; &lt;/Item&gt;
&lt;/Results&gt;
</pre>
<br />
By doing that, the application will call app.Procast_SP_CANVAS_GetFilters to load the filters before loading the canvas area.<br />
To learn more about the canvas filters check point 2. &lt;link&gt;<br />
<br />
<img alt="" src="/media/Canvas/CanvasGeneral1.png" /><br />
<br />
<br />
<strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">1.3 Report groups</span></strong><br />
<br />
To organise your reports in the menu to make them easier to find you may want to use report groups.<br />
You can create such group by creating another item in the menu and referencing the id of this item in your report in the "Parent_Idx" node, as shown below:<br />
<br />
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;
&nbsp; &lt;Item&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;1&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Name&gt;Canvas report example&lt;/Item_Name&gt;
<strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Parent_Idx&gt;REPORT_GROUP&lt;/Parent_Idx&gt;</strong>
&nbsp; &lt;/Item&gt;
<strong>&nbsp; &nbsp;&lt;Item&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;REPORT_GROUP&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Name&gt;Report group&lt;/Item_Name&gt;
&nbsp; &lt;/Item&gt;</strong>
&lt;/Results&gt;
</pre>
<br />
<img alt="" src="data:image/png;base64," /><br />
<br />
<strong><span style="color: #ff0000;">NOTE: You may create &amp; nest as many groups as you want.</span></strong><br />
<br />
<br />
<strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">1.4 Sorting reports</span></strong><br />
<br />
By default, reports appear in your menu in the same order as they appear in the xml.<br />
To override this behaviour you may use the "SortOrder" node.<br />
<br />
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;
&nbsp; &lt;Item&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;1&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Name&gt;Canvas report example&lt;/Item_Name&gt;
<strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;SortOrder&gt;2&lt;/SortOrder&gt;</strong>
&nbsp; &lt;/Item&gt;
&nbsp; &lt;Item&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;2&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Name&gt;Another canvas report example&lt;/Item_Name&gt;
<strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;SortOrder&gt;1&lt;/SortOrder&gt;</strong>
&nbsp; &lt;/Item&gt;
&lt;/Results&gt;
</pre>
<br />
<img alt="" src="data:image/png;base64," /><br />
<br />
In the example above, even though the report of id "2" is appearing after the report of id "1" it will be shown before because its sort order number is lower.<br />
<br />
<strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">2. Canvas filters</span></strong>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">2.1 Loading filters</span></strong></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>
</p>
<p>
</p>
<dir style="line-height: 1.42857;"><span style="color: #ff0000;">In order to load filters for your report you must enable them in the xml for the reports menu beforehand.<br />
For details check point 1.2 "Reports with filters".</span></dir>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<dir style="line-height: 1.42857;"><span style="color: #ff0000;">&nbsp;</span></dir>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>When a report with filters is selected the app calls <strong>app.Procast_SP_CANVAS_GetFilters</strong> to get the data for them&nbsp;with the following xml-in:<br />
<br />
</p>
<pre>&lt;GetFilters&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;User_Idx&gt;&lt;/User_Idx&gt;                    // idx of the logged-in user<br />&nbsp; &lt;Canvas_Report_Idx&gt;&lt;/Canvas_Report_Idx&gt;  // The value of Item_Idx of the report that is being loaded<br />&lt;/GetFilters&gt;</pre>
<p>
The xml to generate filters should be composed of one or multiple vertical grid xmls, where every vertical grid xml makes a filter column.<br />
<br />
An example of such xml may be found below:<span style="line-height: 1.42857;"></span></p>
<p>
</p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;1&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText&gt;First filter column&lt;/HeaderText&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_RowSortOrder&gt;1&lt;/Item_RowSortOrder&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Width&gt;400&lt;/Width&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;FIRST_FILTER&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText&gt;First filter&lt;/HeaderText&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsEditable&gt;1&lt;/IsEditable&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsRequired&gt;1&lt;/IsRequired&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;2&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText&gt;Second filter column&lt;/HeaderText&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_RowSortOrder&gt;2&lt;/Item_RowSortOrder&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Width&gt;400&lt;/Width&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;SECOND_FILTER&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;HeaderText&gt;Second filter&lt;/HeaderText&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsDisplayed&gt;1&lt;/IsDisplayed&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsEditable&gt;1&lt;/IsEditable&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;IsRequired&gt;0&lt;/IsRequired&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;DatePicker&lt;/ControlType&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/RootItem&gt;<br />&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><img alt="" src="data:image/png;base64," /><br />
<br />
<strong><span style="color: #ff0000;">NOTE: for the vertical grid xml details, look for articles prefixed with "VG" in this documentation.</span></strong></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>
<strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">2.2 Saving filter's defaults</span></strong><br />
<br />
The "Save defaults" button allows a user to save the selection he's made on filters, so that the next time the user enters the report the same selection will be automatically made for him.<br />
When a user clicks on the "Save defaults" button the app calls <strong>app.Procast_SP_CANVAS_SaveDefaults</strong> with the following xml-in:<br />
<br />
</p>
<pre>&lt;SaveDefaults&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;User_Idx&gt;&lt;/User_Idx&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // idx of the logged-in user<br />&nbsp; &lt;SalesOrg_Idx&gt;&lt;/SalesOrg_Idx&gt; &nbsp; // idx of the sales organisation the user has currently selected<br />&nbsp; &lt;MenuItem_Idx&gt;&lt;/MenuItem_Idx&gt; &nbsp; // the value of Item_Idx of the report that was loaded<br />&nbsp; &lt;Results&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // serialized selections of the filters<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;RootItem&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;// filter column<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Type&gt;Canvas_Filter&lt;/Item_Type&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;14&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // filter<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;YEARS&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Values&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;// filter's selected values<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Value&gt;2016&lt;/Value&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Values&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;TemplateEditableCheckbox&gt;0&lt;/TemplateEditableCheckbox&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/Results&gt;<br />&lt;/SaveDefaults&gt;</pre>
<br />
<strong><span style="color: #ff0000;">NOTE: every filter column will generate its own "RootItem" node</span></strong><br />
<br />
In response, the app expects to receive a message if the defaults were successfully saved, similar to this one:<br />
<br />
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;SuccessMessage&gt;Filter selections saved.&lt;/SuccessMessage&gt;<br />&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<br />
<strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">2.3 Loading report's canvas area</span></strong><br />
<br />
In case the report has filters, the canvas area can be loaded by clicking on the Apply button. Otherwise it will be loaded straightaway after clicking on the report in the reports menu.<br />
<br />
<span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>3. Canvas area</strong></span><br />
<br />
The canvas area is loaded in two steps. First, the app loads controls without any data inside and places them in respective cells (described in the xml below). Next, the app loads the data for each control asynchronously filtered by the selection made on the filters (if the report has any).<br />
<br />
<span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>3.1 Loading empty controls</strong></span><br />
<br />
The app calls <strong>app.Procast_SP_CANVAS_GetGridItems</strong> to load empty controls with the following xml-in:<br />
<br />
<pre>&lt;GetInsightGrid&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;User_Idx&gt;&lt;/User_Idx&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // idx of the logged-in user<br />&nbsp; &lt;SalesOrg_Idx&gt;&lt;/SalesOrg_Idx&gt; &nbsp; // idx of the sales organisation the user has currently selected<br />&nbsp; &lt;MenuItem_Idx&gt;&lt;/MenuItem_Idx&gt; &nbsp; // the value of Item_Idx of the report that was loaded<br />&nbsp; &lt;Screen_Code&gt;&lt;/Screen_Code&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; // added for consistency; this value is always empty<br />&lt;/GetInsightGrid&gt;</pre>
<br />
and expects the following as a response:<br />
<br />
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;GridControl&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Canvas_Element_Idx&gt;1&lt;/Canvas_Element_Idx&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;// canvas area control idx<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ControlType&gt;DynamicGrid&lt;/ControlType&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;// type of the control; possible values: label, chart, dynamicgrid, pivotgrid<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;DataSource&gt;ProcWithDataForControl&lt;/DataSource&gt; &nbsp; // proc that will be called to load the data for the control<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnIndex&gt;0&lt;/ColumnIndex&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;// which column the control should appear in (indexed from 0!)<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnSpan&gt;10&lt;/ColumnSpan&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // how many columns the control should stretch on<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;RowIndex&gt;0&lt;/RowIndex&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;// which row the control should appear in (indexed from 0!)<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;RowSpan&gt;10&lt;/RowSpan&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // how many rows the control should stretch on<br />&nbsp; &lt;/GridControl&gt;<br />&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<br />
<strong><span style="color: #ff0000;">NOTE: the cells in the canvas area are indexed starting from 0 which that the first column has index of 0, the second column has index of 1 and so on. The same rule applies to rows.<br />
<br />
NOTE: for every control you want to generate in the canvas area you must create a separate "GridControl" node</span></strong>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>3.2 Canvas control cells sizing</strong><br />
</span>
<br />
The default canvas control size is 12x12 cells. This can be altered in the response to the "app.Procast_SP_CANVAS_GetGridItems" proc by specifying the "Number_Of_Horizontal_Cells" and "Number_Of_Vertical_Cells" tags as follows:<br />
<br />
</p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;
<strong>&nbsp; &lt;Number_Of_Horizontal_Cells&gt;x&lt;/Number_Of_Horizontal_Cells&gt;
&nbsp; &lt;Number_Of_Vertical_Cells&gt;u&lt;/Number_Of_Vertical_Cells&gt;</strong>
&nbsp; &lt;GridControl&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; ...
&nbsp; &lt;/GridControl&gt;
&nbsp; ...
&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<br />
The canvas control sizes itself in a way so that it will always show 12x12 cells grid extented on whatever the area it is placed on without the need to show any scrollbars. However, the minimum size of a cell is 80x50 pixels - the canvas control won't resize its cells to be smaller than that and will rather use scrollbars to show all the cells instead. If the assigned number of cells exceeds 12 in any dimension, a respective scrollbar will be applied.
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>3.3 Cells borders</strong></span><br />
<br />
It may be useful to show the cells borders for development purposes. In order to do that add the following tag to the response of "app.Procast_SP_CANVAS_GetGridItems":</p>
<pre>&lt;Results&gt;
&nbsp; <strong>&lt;Show_Cells_Borders&gt;1&lt;/Show_Cells_Borders&gt;</strong>
&nbsp; &lt;GridControl&gt;
&nbsp; &nbsp; ...
&nbsp; &lt;/GridControl&gt;
...
&lt;/Results&gt;</pre>
<p>
<span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><img alt="" src="/media/Canvas/canvasWithBorders.png" style="width: 312px;" /></strong></span></p>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>3.4 Loading data for the controls</strong></span><br />
<br />
After loading the empty controls the app calls a proc (defined in the <strong>app.Procast_SP_CANVAS_GetGridItems</strong> response) for every control to load its content.<br />
The app will send a group of idxs (user, sales organisation, report and control) and the selection made on the filters (if the report has any) as the xml-in, which will look similar to this:<br />
<br />
</p>
<pre>&lt;GetCanvasElement&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;User_Idx&gt;&lt;/User_Idx&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // idx of the logged-in user<br />&nbsp; &lt;SalesOrg_Idx&gt;&lt;/SalesOrg_Idx&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // idx of the sales organisation the user has currently selected<br />&nbsp; &lt;MenuItem_Idx&gt;&lt;/MenuItem_Idx&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // the value of Item_Idx of the report that was loaded<br />&nbsp; &lt;Canvas_Element_Idx&gt;&lt;/Canvas_Element_Idx&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; // the value of Canvas_Element_Idx of the control that is being loaded<br />&nbsp; &lt;Results&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // serialized selections of the filters<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;RootItem&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;// filter column<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Type&gt;Canvas_Filter&lt;/Item_Type&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Item_Idx&gt;14&lt;/Item_Idx&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Attribute&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; // filter<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;ColumnCode&gt;YEARS&lt;/ColumnCode&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Values&gt; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;// filter's selected values<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;Value&gt;2016&lt;/Value&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Values&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;TemplateEditableCheckbox&gt;0&lt;/TemplateEditableCheckbox&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attribute&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/RootItem&gt;<br />&nbsp; &nbsp; &lt;/Attributes&gt;<br />&nbsp; &lt;/Results&gt;<br />&lt;/GetCanvasElement&gt;</pre>
<br />
In response, the app expects to receive an xml suitable to generate the control of type specified in ControlType.
<p>&nbsp;</p>
